title: The 613 Commandments Quiz - Complete Biblical Law Knowledge Test
description: Test your knowledge of all 613 biblical commandments (mitzvot) from the Torah. 50 questions covering positive and negative commandments from Genesis through Deuteronomy.

questions.question: How many positive commandments are there among the 613 mitzvot?
questions.explanation: The traditional enumeration of the mitzvot includes 248 positive commandments as stated in Jewish tradition, representing the number of bones and significant organs in the human body.

questions.question: Which book contains the commandment 'Know there is a G-d'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #1 'Know there is a G-d' is found in Exodus 20:2, emphasizing the foundational belief in G-d.

questions.question: What category does the commandment 'Do not make an idol for yourself' belong to?
questions.explanation: Commandment #29 prohibits making idols and is categorized under Idolatry, found in Exodus 20:4.

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Do not destroy objects associated with G-d's Name' is a positive commandment.
questions.explanation: Commandment #8 is a negative commandment, instructing not to destroy objects related to G-d's Name (Deuteronomy 12:4).

questions.question: Which category includes the commandment 'The priests must bless the Israelite nation daily'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #78 requires priests to bless the nation daily and falls under Levites & Priests (Numbers 6:23).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The month of ___ shall be the first month according to the commandment.
questions.explanation: Commandment #120 states that the month of Nisan (Passover) is the first month of the year (Exodus 12:2).

questions.question: Which commandment prohibits a man from remarrying his ex-wife after she has married someone else?
options: Do not remarry ex-wife after she marries another
Do not hate fellow covenant members
questions.correctAnswer: Do not remarry ex-wife after she marries another
questions.explanation: Commandment #127 forbids a man from remarrying his ex-wife after she has married someone else (Deuteronomy 24:4).

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Do not entice an individual to idol worship' is found in Deuteronomy.
questions.explanation: Commandment #36, prohibiting enticing others to idol worship, is found in Deuteronomy 13:12.

questions.question: Which commandment number corresponds to 'Do not eat meat of an animal that was mortally wounded'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #190 forbids eating meat from an animal mortally wounded (Exodus 22:31).

questions.question: Which of the following is a positive commandment related to Torah?
options: Do not listen to a false prophet
Do not hate fellow covenant members
questions.explanation: Commandment #22 directs to learn Torah and is a positive commandment (Deuteronomy 6:7).

questions.question: True or False: Commandment #71 prohibits women from wearing men's clothing.
questions.explanation: Commandment #71 forbids women from wearing men's clothing and vice versa (Deuteronomy 22:5).

questions.question: What is the category of the commandment 'Do not eat from sacrifices offered with improper intentions'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #393 forbids eating sacrificial meat offered with improper intentions, categorized under Sacrifices and Offerings (Leviticus 7:18).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The High Court must bring an offering when it rules in ___.
questions.explanation: Commandment #435 requires the High Court to bring an offering when it rules in error (Leviticus 4:13).

questions.question: Which book contains the commandment 'Do not listen to a false prophet'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #43 instructs not to listen to false prophets and is found in Deuteronomy 13:4.

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Do not show favor to idolaters' is found in Leviticus.
questions.explanation: Commandment #57 is found in Deuteronomy 7:2 and forbids showing favor to idolaters.

questions.question: Which positive commandment mandates to bless the Almighty after eating?
questions.explanation: Commandment #85 instructs to bless G-d after eating (Deuteronomy 8:10).

questions.question: What category does the commandment 'Do not desire another's possession' fall under?
questions.explanation: Commandment #477 prohibits coveting others' possessions and is categorized under Morality (Deuteronomy 5:18).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The nazarite must not cut his ___.
questions.explanation: Commandment #218 forbids the nazarite from cutting his hair during his vow (Numbers 6:5).

questions.question: True or False: Commandment #71 states that a man shall not wear a woman's clothing.
questions.explanation: Commandment #71 forbids cross-dressing for both men and women (Deuteronomy 22:5).

questions.question: Which commandment number corresponds to 'Do not work with trees to produce fruit during the seventh year'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #281 forbids working with trees during the Shemittah year (Leviticus 25:4).

questions.question: Which commandment commands to 'Lend to the poor and destitute'?
options: Lend to the poor and destitute
Do not eat non-kosher flying insects
questions.correctAnswer: Lend to the poor and destitute
questions.explanation: Commandment #526 commands lending to the poor without charging interest (Exodus 22:25).

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Do not panic and retreat during battle' is a positive commandment.
questions.explanation: Commandment #610 is a negative commandment forbidding panic and retreat (Deuteronomy 20:3).

questions.question: Which book contains the commandment 'Do not do prohibited labor on the Day of Atonement'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #92 forbids labor on Yom Kippur and is found in Leviticus 23:32.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'A man who slanders his wife with accusations of adultery must remain ___ to his wife.'
questions.explanation: Commandment #134 states that a man who slanders his wife must remain married to her (Deuteronomy 22:19).

questions.question: Which category includes the commandment 'Destroy the seven Canaanite nations'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #596 commands the destruction of seven Canaanite nations and is categorized under War and Battles (Deuteronomy 20:17).

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Do not curse your father and mother' is found in Exodus.
questions.explanation: Commandment #582 forbids cursing parents and is located in Exodus 21:17.

questions.question: Which mitzvah forbids eating non-kosher flying insects?
options: Do not eat non-kosher flying insects
Do not eat meat of mortally wounded animal
Do not eat second tithe oil outside Jerusalem
Do not eat bread from new grain before the Omer
questions.correctAnswer: Do not eat non-kosher flying insects
questions.explanation: Commandment #183 forbids eating non-kosher flying insects (Deuteronomy 14:19).

questions.question: What is the polarity of the commandment 'Do not listen to a false prophet'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #43 is a negative commandment prohibiting listening to false prophets (Deuteronomy 13:4).

questions.question: True or False: Commandment #127 states a man can remarry his ex-wife after she married someone else.
questions.explanation: Commandment #127 forbids remarrying an ex-wife after she marries another (Deuteronomy 24:4).

questions.question: Which commandment requires appointing judges in all towns?
questions.explanation: Commandment #540 commands appointing judges and officers in all towns (Deuteronomy 16:18).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Do not bake a meal offering as ___ bread.'
questions.explanation: Commandment #365 forbids baking a meal offering with leaven (Leviticus 6:17).

questions.question: Which commandment instructs 'The court must send the accidental murderer to a city of refuge'?
options: Send accidental murderer to city of refuge
Break the neck of a calf by the river valley
questions.correctAnswer: Send accidental murderer to city of refuge
questions.explanation: Commandment #484 requires the court to send accidental murderers to a city of refuge (Numbers 35:25).

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Do not work with trees to produce fruit during the seventh year' is located in Leviticus.
questions.explanation: Commandment #281 forbids working trees during the Shemittah year and is found in Leviticus 25:4.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids eating bread from new grain before the Omer offering?
options: Do not eat bread from new grain before the Omer
Do not eat second tithe oil outside Jerusalem
Do not eat non-kosher flying insects
Do not eat meat of mortally wounded animal
questions.correctAnswer: Do not eat bread from new grain before the Omer
questions.explanation: Commandment #197 forbids eating bread from new grain before the Omer offering (Leviticus 23:14).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The high priest must not marry a ___.'
questions.explanation: Commandment #169 forbids the high priest from marrying a widow (Leviticus 21:14).

questions.question: What category does the commandment 'Do not have sexual relations with your sister' belong to?
questions.explanation: Commandment #141 prohibits incest with a sister and is categorized under Forbidden Sexual Relationships (Leviticus 18:9).

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Do not build the altar with stones hewn by metal' is found in Exodus.
questions.explanation: Commandment #302 forbids building altars from cut stones using metal tools (Exodus 20:25).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids a priest from entering the Temple with torn clothes?
options: Do not enter Temple with torn clothes
Do not eat second tithe oil outside Jerusalem
Do not offer sacrifices outside courtyard
Do not bake meal offering with leaven
questions.correctAnswer: Do not enter Temple with torn clothes
questions.explanation: Commandment #323 forbids priests from entering the Temple with torn clothes (Leviticus 10:6).

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Do not eat meat of an animal that was mortally wounded' is negative.
questions.explanation: Commandment #190 is a negative commandment prohibiting eating meat of mortally wounded animals (Exodus 22:31).

questions.question: Which commandment requires the Levite to set aside a tenth of his tithe for the priest?
options: Set aside a tenth of tithe for priest
Leave a corner of the field for the poor
questions.correctAnswer: Set aside a tenth of tithe for priest
questions.explanation: Commandment #253 requires Levites to give a tenth of their tithe to the priests (Numbers 18:26).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The court must judge the damages incurred by a ___ ox.'
questions.explanation: Commandment #463 requires courts to judge damages caused by a goring ox (Exodus 21:28).

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'The high priest must not enter under the same roof as a corpse' is in Leviticus.
questions.explanation: Commandment #589 prohibits the high priest from being under the same roof as a corpse (Leviticus 21:11).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids relatives of litigants to testify in court?
options: Relatives of litigants must not testify
questions.correctAnswer: Relatives of litigants must not testify
questions.explanation: Commandment #575 forbids relatives of litigants from testifying to avoid bias (Deuteronomy 24:16).

questions.question: Which commandment number corresponds to 'Do not sell the land in Israel indefinitely'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #295 forbids permanent sale of land in Israel (Leviticus 25:23).

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'The court must not exceed the prescribed number of lashes' is in Deuteronomy.
questions.explanation: Commandment #554 limits lashes to forty and is found in Deuteronomy 25:3.

questions.question: Which commandment instructs to 'Break the neck of a calf by the river valley following an unsolved murder'?
options: Break neck of calf by river valley
Do not panic and retreat during battle
questions.correctAnswer: Break neck of calf by river valley
questions.explanation: Commandment #491 commands this ritual after an unsolved murder (Deuteronomy 21:4).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Do not pick the unformed clusters of grapes but leave them for the ___.'
questions.explanation: Commandment #246 instructs leaving unformed grape clusters for the poor (Leviticus 19:10).

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'The nazarite must not come into contact with the dead' is a positive commandment.
questions.explanation: Commandment #225 is a negative commandment forbidding contact with the dead (Numbers 6:7).

questions.question: Which commandment states 'Do not deny possession of something entrusted to you'?
options: Do not deny possession of entrusted property
questions.correctAnswer: Do not deny possession of entrusted property
questions.explanation: Commandment #211 forbids denying possession of entrusted items (Leviticus 19:11).

questions.question: Which category does the commandment 'Celebrate on Passover, the Feast of Weeks, and the Feast of Tabernacles and bring a peace offering' belong to?
questions.explanation: Commandment #421 commands celebration of these feasts and is under Appointed Times (Exodus 23:14).
